name: INF-HSEQ CC0375-ITP-025 Minor Concrete Structures - Rev.1
template name: INF-HSEQ CC0375-ITP-025 Minor Concrete Structures - Rev.1

name: Ref docs - Issued drawings / Site copy drawings
Acceptance criteria - Check that you have the latest site and engineering drawings BEFORE starting each task/set of tasks.
Acceptance criteria - Prepare a lot map for traceability of the work area
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Acceptance criteria - Setout structure to the location and levels on the drawings. This shall be presented for inspection by the superintendent.
Acceptance criteria - Blinding (15MPa) for Reinforced Concrete Bases to be a 50mm thick mass concrete layer.
○ Unreinforced bases can be poured directly on the earth
Ref docs - Spec. 0319 Minor Concrete Works [Cl 4.3] Drawings
Acceptance criteria - Formwork installed as per drawings and adequately supported.
○ Completed formwork to be inspected by the Superintendent prior to concrete placement
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Ref docs - Spec. 0319 Minor Concrete Works [Cl 4.5] Drawings
Acceptance criteria - Reinforcement installed as per drawings, ensuring sufficient lap length and cover is achieved on all bars.
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Ref docs - Spec. 0319 Minor Concrete Works [Cl 4.8, 4.9, 4.10, 4.11] Drawings
Acceptance criteria - Concrete strength of cast in-situ units shall be min. Grade N32 or as otherwise stated on drawings.
○ Ensure the temperature of freshly mixed concrete is maintained in between 5°C and 35°C. Ensure elapsed time between batching and discharge of the mix complies with the below table.
Concrete temperature at time of discharge (°C) || Maximum elapsed time (hours)
○ Concrete placed in layers ≤ 300mm thick and adequately vibrated avoiding over-vibration.
○ Design slump shall not exceed 75mm unless shown otherwise on the drawings.
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Ref docs - Spec. 0319 Minor Concrete Works [Cl 4.2]
Acceptance criteria - The nominal rate of sampling shall be taken:
(a) Compressive strength: One set per pour or as otherwise directed by the Superintendent;
(b) Slump: One per batch of concrete
○ Slump within tolerances specified in AS 1379
○ Testing to be in a NATA accredited test facility
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Ref docs - Spec. 0319 Minor Concrete Works [Cl 4.13]
Acceptance criteria - From completion of finishing; cure continuously with either curing compound, wet curing or form retention until 15MPa is achieved unless directed otherwise by the superintendent
Acceptance criteria - Certificates received, reviewed, and conforming to requirements for each pour. Average compressive strength at 28 days meets minimum design requirements
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Acceptance criteria - An as-built survey completed to ensure all structures are within construction tolerances.
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
4.2 - Acceptance and closure of non-conforming items
Acceptance criteria - NCRs to be opened for non-conforming items and closed prior to closing construction lot.
